**Job Posting: Live CCTV Video Streaming Developer** **Position:** Freelance/Contract Developer (Remote) **Project Duration:** [3‚Äì6 months] **Budget:** ["Negotiable"] ---### **About the Project** We‚Äôre building a mobile/web app to display live video feeds from CCTV cameras (IP-based) in real time. The goal is to integrate secure, low-latency streaming from cameras using protocols like RTSP, HLS, or WebRTC. The app will serve both Android and iOS users, with potential web integration. ---### **Responsibilities** 1. Design and implement a live video streaming system for CCTV camera feeds. 2. Integrate camera streams (RTSP, ONVIF, or HTTP/MJPEG) into the app with playback functionality. 3. Optimize latency, quality, and bandwidth usage for real-time viewing. 4. Ensure secure access (token-based authentication, VPN, HTTPS). 5. Set up a backend proxy/transcoding server (e.g., NGINX, FFmpeg) if required. 6. Collaborate with our team to troubleshoot and test across devices/networks. 7. Document the architecture and workflows. ---### **Required Skills** - **Video Streaming Expertise**:  - Protocols: RTSP, HLS, WebRTC, RTMP.  - Tools: FFmpeg, GStreamer, ExoPlayer (Android), AVPlayer (iOS), or WebRTC libraries. - **Mobile/Web Development**:  - Android (Kotlin/Java) and/or iOS (Swift) for mobile apps.  - Web: JavaScript, HLS.js, video.js, or WebRTC (React/Node.js). - **Backend/Server Skills** (if needed):  - Setting up proxy servers (NGINX RTMP, Node.js).  - Cloud services (AWS IVS, GCP) for transcoding/CDN. - **Security**: HTTPS, DRM, token authentication, firewall rules. - **Testing**: Latency optimization, codec troubleshooting (H.264/H.265). ---### **Preferred Qualifications** - Experience with CCTV/IP camera systems (e.g., ONVIF, Dahua, Hikvision). - Knowledge of IoT frameworks (e.g., AWS IoT Core). - Familiarity with analytics tools (Mux, Bitmovin). - Portfolio of similar live-streaming projects. ---### **Deliverables** 1. A working app with live CCTV feed integration. 2. Documentation for setup, maintenance, and API usage. 3. Optimized streaming pipeline with <2s latency (if possible). ---### **How to Apply** Submit your proposal with: - A brief cover letter explaining your approach to live streaming. - Examples of past projects (GitHub, demos, or case studies). - Hourly rate or project-based quote. **Contact:** [muneebumughal@gmail.com] ---### **Why Work With Us?** - Opportunity to shape a scalable video surveillance solution. - Flexible remote work with a collaborative team.

ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêØùê¢ùêûùê∞ ùêêùêÆùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß : ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ ùêéùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùê°ùêûùê•ùê© ùê¢ùêß ùêöùêØùê®ùê¢ùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêçùêÆùê•ùê•ùêèùê®ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêÑùê±ùêúùêûùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß? ‚úÖ Traditionally, if a method might return null, you'd have to manually check for null before accessing the value:String name = getUserName(); // might return nullif (name != null) { System.out.println(name.length());} else { // handle null}If you forget that null check and call name.length(), boom üí• ‚Äî NullPointerException.‚úÖ The Solution: OptionalInstead of returning null, return an Optional<T>:Optional<String> name = getUserName(); // returns Optional<String>name.ifPresent(n -> System.out.println(n.length()));Or with a default value:String result = name.orElse("Default Name");Or throwing an exception intentionally:String result = name.orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Name not found"));üì¶ How Optional HelpsForces explicit handling of absence of value.Avoids accidental null dereference.Cleaner, more readable code than nested null checks.üö® When it MattersFor performance-critical code (e.g., tight loops, mobile), Optional might have a micro-performance hit.For clean code, API design, and readability, Optional is a clear win.hashtag#interview hashtag#java

ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêØùê¢ùêûùê∞ ùêêùêÆùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß : ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ ùêéùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùê°ùêûùê•ùê© ùê¢ùêß ùêöùêØùê®ùê¢ùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêçùêÆùê•ùê•ùêèùê®ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêÑùê±ùêúùêûùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß? ‚úÖ Traditionally, if a method might return null, you'd have to manually check for null before accessing the value:String name = getUserName(); // might return nullif (name != null) { System.out.println(name.length());} else { // handle null}If you forget that null check and call name.length(), boom üí• ‚Äî NullPointerException.‚úÖ The Solution: OptionalInstead of returning null, return an Optional<T>:Optional<String> name = getUserName(); // returns Optional<String>name.ifPresent(n -> System.out.println(n.length()));Or with a default value:String result = name.orElse("Default Name");Or throwing an exception intentionally:String result = name.orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Name not found"));üì¶ How Optional HelpsForces explicit handling of absence of value.Avoids accidental null dereference.Cleaner, more readable code than nested null checks.üö® When it MattersFor performance-critical code (e.g., tight loops, mobile), Optional might have a micro-performance hit.For clean code, API design, and readability, Optional is a clear win.hashtag#interview hashtag#java

**Job Posting: Live CCTV Video Streaming Developer** **Position:** Freelance/Contract Developer (Remote) **Project Duration:** [3‚Äì6 months] **Budget:** ["Negotiable"] ---### **About the Project** We‚Äôre building a mobile/web app to display live video feeds from CCTV cameras (IP-based) in real time. The goal is to integrate secure, low-latency streaming from cameras using protocols like RTSP, HLS, or WebRTC. The app will serve both Android and iOS users, with potential web integration. ---### **Responsibilities** 1. Design and implement a live video streaming system for CCTV camera feeds. 2. Integrate camera streams (RTSP, ONVIF, or HTTP/MJPEG) into the app with playback functionality. 3. Optimize latency, quality, and bandwidth usage for real-time viewing. 4. Ensure secure access (token-based authentication, VPN, HTTPS). 5. Set up a backend proxy/transcoding server (e.g., NGINX, FFmpeg) if required. 6. Collaborate with our team to troubleshoot and test across devices/networks. 7. Document the architecture and workflows. ---### **Required Skills** - **Video Streaming Expertise**:  - Protocols: RTSP, HLS, WebRTC, RTMP.  - Tools: FFmpeg, GStreamer, ExoPlayer (Android), AVPlayer (iOS), or WebRTC libraries. - **Mobile/Web Development**:  - Android (Kotlin/Java) and/or iOS (Swift) for mobile apps.  - Web: JavaScript, HLS.js, video.js, or WebRTC (React/Node.js). - **Backend/Server Skills** (if needed):  - Setting up proxy servers (NGINX RTMP, Node.js).  - Cloud services (AWS IVS, GCP) for transcoding/CDN. - **Security**: HTTPS, DRM, token authentication, firewall rules. - **Testing**: Latency optimization, codec troubleshooting (H.264/H.265). ---### **Preferred Qualifications** - Experience with CCTV/IP camera systems (e.g., ONVIF, Dahua, Hikvision). - Knowledge of IoT frameworks (e.g., AWS IoT Core). - Familiarity with analytics tools (Mux, Bitmovin). - Portfolio of similar live-streaming projects. ---### **Deliverables** 1. A working app with live CCTV feed integration. 2. Documentation for setup, maintenance, and API usage. 3. Optimized streaming pipeline with <2s latency (if possible). ---### **How to Apply** Submit your proposal with: - A brief cover letter explaining your approach to live streaming. - Examples of past projects (GitHub, demos, or case studies). - Hourly rate or project-based quote. **Contact:** [muneebumughal@gmail.com] ---### **Why Work With Us?** - Opportunity to shape a scalable video surveillance solution. - Flexible remote work with a collaborative team.

ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêØùê¢ùêûùê∞ ùêêùêÆùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß : ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ ùêéùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùê°ùêûùê•ùê© ùê¢ùêß ùêöùêØùê®ùê¢ùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêçùêÆùê•ùê•ùêèùê®ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêÑùê±ùêúùêûùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß? ‚úÖ Traditionally, if a method might return null, you'd have to manually check for null before accessing the value:String name = getUserName(); // might return nullif (name != null) { System.out.println(name.length());} else { // handle null}If you forget that null check and call name.length(), boom üí• ‚Äî NullPointerException.‚úÖ The Solution: OptionalInstead of returning null, return an Optional<T>:Optional<String> name = getUserName(); // returns Optional<String>name.ifPresent(n -> System.out.println(n.length()));Or with a default value:String result = name.orElse("Default Name");Or throwing an exception intentionally:String result = name.orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Name not found"));üì¶ How Optional HelpsForces explicit handling of absence of value.Avoids accidental null dereference.Cleaner, more readable code than nested null checks.üö® When it MattersFor performance-critical code (e.g., tight loops, mobile), Optional might have a micro-performance hit.For clean code, API design, and readability, Optional is a clear win.hashtag#interview hashtag#java

Integrate camera streams (RTSP, ONVIF, or HTTP/MJPEG) into the app with playback functionality. 3. Optimize latency, quality, and bandwidth usage for real-time viewing. 4. Ensure secure access (token-based authentication, VPN, HTTPS). 5. Set up a backend proxy/transcoding server (e.g., NGINX, FFmpeg) if required. 6. A working app with live CCTV feed integration. 2. Documentation for setup, maintenance, and API usage. 3. ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêØùê¢ùêûùê∞ ùêêùêÆùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß : ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ ùêéùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùê°ùêûùê•ùê© ùê¢ùêß ùêöùêØùê®ùê¢ùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêçùêÆùê•ùê•ùêèùê®ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêÑùê±ùêúùêûùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß? ‚úÖ Traditionally, if a method might return null, you'd have to manually check for null before accessing the value:String name = getUserName(); // might return nullif (name != null) { System.out.println(name.length());} else { // handle null}If you forget that null check and call name.length(), boom üí• ‚Äî NullPointerException.‚úÖ The Solution: OptionalInstead of returning null, return an Optional<T>:Optional<String> name = getUserName(); // returns Optional<String>name.ifPresent(n -> System.out.println(n.length()));Or with a default value:String result = name.orElse("Default Name");Or throwing an exception intentionally:String result = name.orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Name not found"));üì¶ How Optional HelpsForces explicit handling of absence of value.Avoids accidental null dereference.Cleaner, more readable code than nested null checks.üö® When it MattersFor performance-critical code (e.g., tight loops, mobile), Optional might have a micro-performance hit.For clean code, API design, and readability, Optional is a clear win.hashtag#interview hashtag#java

**Job Posting: Live CCTV Video Streaming Developer** **Position:** Freelance/Contract Developer (Remote) **Project Duration:** [3‚Äì6 months] **Budget:** ["Negotiable"] ---### **About the Project** We‚Äôre building a mobile/web app to display live video feeds from CCTV cameras (IP-based) in real time. The goal is to integrate secure, low-latency streaming from cameras using protocols like RTSP, HLS, or WebRTC. The app will serve both Android and iOS users, with potential web integration. ---### **Responsibilities** 1. Design and implement a live video streaming system for CCTV camera feeds. 2. Integrate camera streams (RTSP, ONVIF, or HTTP/MJPEG) into the app with playback functionality. 3. Optimize latency, quality, and bandwidth usage for real-time viewing. 4. Ensure secure access (token-based authentication, VPN, HTTPS). 5. Set up a backend proxy/transcoding server (e.g., NGINX, FFmpeg) if required. 6. Collaborate with our team to troubleshoot and test across devices/networks. 7. Document the architecture and workflows. ---### **Required Skills** - **Video Streaming Expertise**:  - Protocols: RTSP, HLS, WebRTC, RTMP.  - Tools: FFmpeg, GStreamer, ExoPlayer (Android), AVPlayer (iOS), or WebRTC libraries. - **Mobile/Web Development**:  - Android (Kotlin/Java) and/or iOS (Swift) for mobile apps.  - Web: JavaScript, HLS.js, video.js, or WebRTC (React/Node.js). - **Backend/Server Skills** (if needed):  - Setting up proxy servers (NGINX RTMP, Node.js).  - Cloud services (AWS IVS, GCP) for transcoding/CDN. - **Security**: HTTPS, DRM, token authentication, firewall rules. - **Testing**: Latency optimization, codec troubleshooting (H.264/H.265). ---### **Preferred Qualifications** - Experience with CCTV/IP camera systems (e.g., ONVIF, Dahua, Hikvision). - Knowledge of IoT frameworks (e.g., AWS IoT Core). - Familiarity with analytics tools (Mux, Bitmovin). - Portfolio of similar live-streaming projects. ---### **Deliverables** 1. A working app with live CCTV feed integration. 2. Documentation for setup, maintenance, and API usage. 3. Optimized streaming pipeline with <2s latency (if possible). ---### **How to Apply** Submit your proposal with: - A brief cover letter explaining your approach to live streaming. - Examples of past projects (GitHub, demos, or case studies). - Hourly rate or project-based quote. **Contact:** [muneebumughal@gmail.com] ---### **Why Work With Us?** - Opportunity to shape a scalable video surveillance solution. - Flexible remote work with a collaborative team.

ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêØùê¢ùêûùê∞ ùêêùêÆùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß : ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ ùêéùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùê°ùêûùê•ùê© ùê¢ùêß ùêöùêØùê®ùê¢ùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêçùêÆùê•ùê•ùêèùê®ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêÑùê±ùêúùêûùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß? ‚úÖ Traditionally, if a method might return null, you'd have to manually check for null before accessing the value:String name = getUserName(); // might return nullif (name != null) { System.out.println(name.length());} else { // handle null}If you forget that null check and call name.length(), boom üí• ‚Äî NullPointerException.‚úÖ The Solution: OptionalInstead of returning null, return an Optional<T>:Optional<String> name = getUserName(); // returns Optional<String>name.ifPresent(n -> System.out.println(n.length()));Or with a default value:String result = name.orElse("Default Name");Or throwing an exception intentionally:String result = name.orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Name not found"));üì¶ How Optional HelpsForces explicit handling of absence of value.Avoids accidental null dereference.Cleaner, more readable code than nested null checks.üö® When it MattersFor performance-critical code (e.g., tight loops, mobile), Optional might have a micro-performance hit.For clean code, API design, and readability, Optional is a clear win.hashtag#interview hashtag#java

The app will serve both Android and iOS users, with potential web integration. ---### **Responsibilities** 1. Design and implement a live video streaming system for CCTV camera feeds. 2. Integrate camera streams (RTSP, ONVIF, or HTTP/MJPEG) into the app with playback functionality. 3. Optimize latency, quality, and bandwidth usage for real-time viewing. 4. Ensure secure access (token-based authentication, VPN, HTTPS). 5. Set up a backend proxy/transcoding server (e.g., NGINX, FFmpeg) if required. 6. Collaborate with our team to troubleshoot and test across devices/networks. 7. Document the architecture and workflows. ---### **Required Skills** - **Video Streaming Expertise**:  - Protocols: RTSP, HLS, WebRTC, RTMP.  - Tools: FFmpeg, GStreamer, ExoPlayer (Android), AVPlayer (iOS), or WebRTC libraries. - **Mobile/Web Development**:  - Android (Kotlin/Java) and/or iOS (Swift) for mobile apps.  - Web: JavaScript, HLS.js, video.js, or WebRTC (React/Node.js). - **Backend/Server Skills** (if needed):  - Setting up proxy servers (NGINX RTMP, Node.js).  - Cloud services (AWS IVS, GCP) for transcoding/CDN. - **Security**: HTTPS, DRM, token authentication, firewall rules. - **Testing**: Latency optimization, codec troubleshooting (H.264/H.265). ---### **Preferred Qualifications** - Experience with CCTV/IP camera systems (e.g., ONVIF, Dahua, Hikvision). - Knowledge of IoT frameworks (e.g., AWS IoT Core). - Familiarity with analytics tools (Mux, Bitmovin). - Portfolio of similar live-streaming projects. ---### **Deliverables** 1. A working app with live CCTV feed integration. 2. Documentation for setup, maintenance, and API usage. 3. Optimized streaming pipeline with <2s latency (if possible). ---### **How to Apply** Submit your proposal with: - A brief cover letter explaining your approach to live streaming. - Examples of past projects (GitHub, demos, or case studies). - Hourly rate or project-based quote. **Contact:** [muneebumughal@gmail.com] ---### **Why Work With Us?** - Opportunity to shape a scalable video surveillance solution. - Flexible remote work with a collaborative team.

ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêØùê¢ùêûùê∞ ùêêùêÆùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß : ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ ùêéùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùê°ùêûùê•ùê© ùê¢ùêß ùêöùêØùê®ùê¢ùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêçùêÆùê•ùê•ùêèùê®ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêÑùê±ùêúùêûùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß? ‚úÖ Traditionally, if a method might return null, you'd have to manually check for null before accessing the value:String name = getUserName(); // might return nullif (name != null) { System.out.println(name.length());} else { // handle null}If you forget that null check and call name.length(), boom üí• ‚Äî NullPointerException.‚úÖ The Solution: OptionalInstead of returning null, return an Optional<T>:Optional<String> name = getUserName(); // returns Optional<String>name.ifPresent(n -> System.out.println(n.length()));Or with a default value:String result = name.orElse("Default Name");Or throwing an exception intentionally:String result = name.orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Name not found"));üì¶ How Optional HelpsForces explicit handling of absence of value.Avoids accidental null dereference.Cleaner, more readable code than nested null checks.üö® When it MattersFor performance-critical code (e.g., tight loops, mobile), Optional might have a micro-performance hit.For clean code, API design, and readability, Optional is a clear win.hashtag#interview hashtag#java

**Job Posting: Live CCTV Video Streaming Developer** **Position:** Freelance/Contract Developer (Remote) **Project Duration:** [3‚Äì6 months] **Budget:** ["Negotiable"] ---### **About the Project** We‚Äôre building a mobile/web app to display live video feeds from CCTV cameras (IP-based) in real time. The goal is to integrate secure, low-latency streaming from cameras using protocols like RTSP, HLS, or WebRTC. The app will serve both Android and iOS users, with potential web integration. ---### **Responsibilities** 1. Design and implement a live video streaming system for CCTV camera feeds. 2. Integrate camera streams (RTSP, ONVIF, or HTTP/MJPEG) into the app with playback functionality. 3. Optimize latency, quality, and bandwidth usage for real-time viewing. 4. Ensure secure access (token-based authentication, VPN, HTTPS). 5. Set up a backend proxy/transcoding server (e.g., NGINX, FFmpeg) if required. 6. Collaborate with our team to troubleshoot and test across devices/networks. 7. Document the architecture and workflows. ---### **Required Skills** - **Video Streaming Expertise**:  - Protocols: RTSP, HLS, WebRTC, RTMP.  - Tools: FFmpeg, GStreamer, ExoPlayer (Android), AVPlayer (iOS), or WebRTC libraries. - **Mobile/Web Development**:  - Android (Kotlin/Java) and/or iOS (Swift) for mobile apps.  - Web: JavaScript, HLS.js, video.js, or WebRTC (React/Node.js). - **Backend/Server Skills** (if needed):  - Setting up proxy servers (NGINX RTMP, Node.js).  - Cloud services (AWS IVS, GCP) for transcoding/CDN. - **Security**: HTTPS, DRM, token authentication, firewall rules. - **Testing**: Latency optimization, codec troubleshooting (H.264/H.265). ---### **Preferred Qualifications** - Experience with CCTV/IP camera systems (e.g., ONVIF, Dahua, Hikvision). - Knowledge of IoT frameworks (e.g., AWS IoT Core). - Familiarity with analytics tools (Mux, Bitmovin). - Portfolio of similar live-streaming projects. ---### **Deliverables** 1. A working app with live CCTV feed integration. 2. Documentation for setup, maintenance, and API usage. 3. Optimized streaming pipeline with <2s latency (if possible). ---### **How to Apply** Submit your proposal with: - A brief cover letter explaining your approach to live streaming. - Examples of past projects (GitHub, demos, or case studies). - Hourly rate or project-based quote. **Contact:** [muneebumughal@gmail.com] ---### **Why Work With Us?** - Opportunity to shape a scalable video surveillance solution. - Flexible remote work with a collaborative team.

ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêØùê¢ùêûùê∞ ùêêùêÆùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß : ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ ùêéùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùê°ùêûùê•ùê© ùê¢ùêß ùêöùêØùê®ùê¢ùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêçùêÆùê•ùê•ùêèùê®ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêÑùê±ùêúùêûùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß? ‚úÖ Traditionally, if a method might return null, you'd have to manually check for null before accessing the value:String name = getUserName(); // might return nullif (name != null) { System.out.println(name.length());} else { // handle null}If you forget that null check and call name.length(), boom üí• ‚Äî NullPointerException.‚úÖ The Solution: OptionalInstead of returning null, return an Optional<T>:Optional<String> name = getUserName(); // returns Optional<String>name.ifPresent(n -> System.out.println(n.length()));Or with a default value:String result = name.orElse("Default Name");Or throwing an exception intentionally:String result = name.orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Name not found"));üì¶ How Optional HelpsForces explicit handling of absence of value.Avoids accidental null dereference.Cleaner, more readable code than nested null checks.üö® When it MattersFor performance-critical code (e.g., tight loops, mobile), Optional might have a micro-performance hit.For clean code, API design, and readability, Optional is a clear win.hashtag#interview hashtag#java

The goal is to integrate secure, low-latency streaming from cameras using protocols like RTSP, HLS, or WebRTC. The app will serve both Android and iOS users, with potential web integration. ---### **Responsibilities** 1. Design and implement a live video streaming system for CCTV camera feeds. 2. Integrate camera streams (RTSP, ONVIF, or HTTP/MJPEG) into the app with playback functionality. 3. Optimize latency, quality, and bandwidth usage for real-time viewing. 4. Ensure secure access (token-based authentication, VPN, HTTPS). 5. Set up a backend proxy/transcoding server (e.g., NGINX, FFmpeg) if required. 6. Collaborate with our team to troubleshoot and test across devices/networks. 7. Document the architecture and workflows. ---### **Required Skills** - **Video Streaming Expertise**:  - Protocols: RTSP, HLS, WebRTC, RTMP.  - Tools: FFmpeg, GStreamer, ExoPlayer (Android), AVPlayer (iOS), or WebRTC libraries. - **Mobile/Web Development**:  - Android (Kotlin/Java) and/or iOS (Swift) for mobile apps.  - Web: JavaScript, HLS.js, video.js, or WebRTC (React/Node.js). - **Backend/Server Skills** (if needed):  - Setting up proxy servers (NGINX RTMP, Node.js).  - Cloud services (AWS IVS, GCP) for transcoding/CDN. - **Security**: HTTPS, DRM, token authentication, firewall rules. - **Testing**: Latency optimization, codec troubleshooting (H.264/H.265). ---### **Preferred Qualifications** - Experience with CCTV/IP camera systems (e.g., ONVIF, Dahua, Hikvision). - Knowledge of IoT frameworks (e.g., AWS IoT Core). - Familiarity with analytics tools (Mux, Bitmovin). - Portfolio of similar live-streaming projects. ---### **Deliverables** 1. A working app with live CCTV feed integration. 2. Documentation for setup, maintenance, and API usage. 3. Optimized streaming pipeline with <2s latency (if possible). ---### **How to Apply** Submit your proposal with: - A brief cover letter explaining your approach to live streaming. - Examples of past projects (GitHub, demos, or case studies). - Hourly rate or project-based quote. **Contact:** [muneebumughal@gmail.com] ---### **Why Work With Us?** - Opportunity to shape a scalable video surveillance solution. - Flexible remote work with a collaborative team.

ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêØùê¢ùêûùê∞ ùêêùêÆùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß : ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ ùêéùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùê°ùêûùê•ùê© ùê¢ùêß ùêöùêØùê®ùê¢ùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêçùêÆùê•ùê•ùêèùê®ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêÑùê±ùêúùêûùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß? ‚úÖ Traditionally, if a method might return null, you'd have to manually check for null before accessing the value:String name = getUserName(); // might return nullif (name != null) { System.out.println(name.length());} else { // handle null}If you forget that null check and call name.length(), boom üí• ‚Äî NullPointerException.‚úÖ The Solution: OptionalInstead of returning null, return an Optional<T>:Optional<String> name = getUserName(); // returns Optional<String>name.ifPresent(n -> System.out.println(n.length()));Or with a default value:String result = name.orElse("Default Name");Or throwing an exception intentionally:String result = name.orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Name not found"));üì¶ How Optional HelpsForces explicit handling of absence of value.Avoids accidental null dereference.Cleaner, more readable code than nested null checks.üö® When it MattersFor performance-critical code (e.g., tight loops, mobile), Optional might have a micro-performance hit.For clean code, API design, and readability, Optional is a clear win.hashtag#interview hashtag#java

**Job Posting: Live CCTV Video Streaming Developer** **Position:** Freelance/Contract Developer (Remote) **Project Duration:** [3‚Äì6 months] **Budget:** ["Negotiable"] ---### **About the Project** We‚Äôre building a mobile/web app to display live video feeds from CCTV cameras (IP-based) in real time. The goal is to integrate secure, low-latency streaming from cameras using protocols like RTSP, HLS, or WebRTC. The app will serve both Android and iOS users, with potential web integration. ---### **Responsibilities** 1. Design and implement a live video streaming system for CCTV camera feeds. 2. Integrate camera streams (RTSP, ONVIF, or HTTP/MJPEG) into the app with playback functionality. 3. Optimize latency, quality, and bandwidth usage for real-time viewing. 4. Ensure secure access (token-based authentication, VPN, HTTPS). 5. Set up a backend proxy/transcoding server (e.g., NGINX, FFmpeg) if required. 6. Collaborate with our team to troubleshoot and test across devices/networks. 7. Document the architecture and workflows. ---### **Required Skills** - **Video Streaming Expertise**:  - Protocols: RTSP, HLS, WebRTC, RTMP.  - Tools: FFmpeg, GStreamer, ExoPlayer (Android), AVPlayer (iOS), or WebRTC libraries. - **Mobile/Web Development**:  - Android (Kotlin/Java) and/or iOS (Swift) for mobile apps.  - Web: JavaScript, HLS.js, video.js, or WebRTC (React/Node.js). - **Backend/Server Skills** (if needed):  - Setting up proxy servers (NGINX RTMP, Node.js).  - Cloud services (AWS IVS, GCP) for transcoding/CDN. - **Security**: HTTPS, DRM, token authentication, firewall rules. - **Testing**: Latency optimization, codec troubleshooting (H.264/H.265). ---### **Preferred Qualifications** - Experience with CCTV/IP camera systems (e.g., ONVIF, Dahua, Hikvision). - Knowledge of IoT frameworks (e.g., AWS IoT Core). - Familiarity with analytics tools (Mux, Bitmovin). - Portfolio of similar live-streaming projects. ---### **Deliverables** 1. A working app with live CCTV feed integration. 2. Documentation for setup, maintenance, and API usage. 3. Optimized streaming pipeline with <2s latency (if possible). ---### **How to Apply** Submit your proposal with: - A brief cover letter explaining your approach to live streaming. - Examples of past projects (GitHub, demos, or case studies). - Hourly rate or project-based quote. **Contact:** [muneebumughal@gmail.com] ---### **Why Work With Us?** - Opportunity to shape a scalable video surveillance solution. - Flexible remote work with a collaborative team.

ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêØùê¢ùêûùê∞ ùêêùêÆùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß : ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ ùêéùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùê°ùêûùê•ùê© ùê¢ùêß ùêöùêØùê®ùê¢ùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêçùêÆùê•ùê•ùêèùê®ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêÑùê±ùêúùêûùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß? ‚úÖ Traditionally, if a method might return null, you'd have to manually check for null before accessing the value:String name = getUserName(); // might return nullif (name != null) { System.out.println(name.length());} else { // handle null}If you forget that null check and call name.length(), boom üí• ‚Äî NullPointerException.‚úÖ The Solution: OptionalInstead of returning null, return an Optional<T>:Optional<String> name = getUserName(); // returns Optional<String>name.ifPresent(n -> System.out.println(n.length()));Or with a default value:String result = name.orElse("Default Name");Or throwing an exception intentionally:String result = name.orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Name not found"));üì¶ How Optional HelpsForces explicit handling of absence of value.Avoids accidental null dereference.Cleaner, more readable code than nested null checks.üö® When it MattersFor performance-critical code (e.g., tight loops, mobile), Optional might have a micro-performance hit.For clean code, API design, and readability, Optional is a clear win.hashtag#interview hashtag#java

**Job Posting: Live CCTV Video Streaming Developer** **Position:** Freelance/Contract Developer (Remote) **Project Duration:** [3‚Äì6 months] **Budget:** ["Negotiable"] ---### **About the Project** We‚Äôre building a mobile/web app to display live video feeds from CCTV cameras (IP-based) in real time. The goal is to integrate secure, low-latency streaming from cameras using protocols like RTSP, HLS, or WebRTC. The app will serve both Android and iOS users, with potential web integration. ---### **Responsibilities** 1. Design and implement a live video streaming system for CCTV camera feeds. 2. Integrate camera streams (RTSP, ONVIF, or HTTP/MJPEG) into the app with playback functionality. 3. Optimize latency, quality, and bandwidth usage for real-time viewing. 4. Ensure secure access (token-based authentication, VPN, HTTPS). 5. Set up a backend proxy/transcoding server (e.g., NGINX, FFmpeg) if required. 6. Collaborate with our team to troubleshoot and test across devices/networks. 7. Document the architecture and workflows. ---### **Required Skills** - **Video Streaming Expertise**:  - Protocols: RTSP, HLS, WebRTC, RTMP.  - Tools: FFmpeg, GStreamer, ExoPlayer (Android), AVPlayer (iOS), or WebRTC libraries. - **Mobile/Web Development**:  - Android (Kotlin/Java) and/or iOS (Swift) for mobile apps.  - Web: JavaScript, HLS.js, video.js, or WebRTC (React/Node.js). - **Backend/Server Skills** (if needed):  - Setting up proxy servers (NGINX RTMP, Node.js).  - Cloud services (AWS IVS, GCP) for transcoding/CDN. - **Security**: HTTPS, DRM, token authentication, firewall rules. - **Testing**: Latency optimization, codec troubleshooting (H.264/H.265). ---### **Preferred Qualifications** - Experience with CCTV/IP camera systems (e.g., ONVIF, Dahua, Hikvision). - Knowledge of IoT frameworks (e.g., AWS IoT Core). - Familiarity with analytics tools (Mux, Bitmovin). - Portfolio of similar live-streaming projects. ---### **Deliverables** 1. ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêØùê¢ùêûùê∞ ùêêùêÆùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß : ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ ùêéùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùê°ùêûùê•ùê© ùê¢ùêß ùêöùêØùê®ùê¢ùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêçùêÆùê•ùê•ùêèùê®ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêÑùê±ùêúùêûùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß? ‚úÖ Traditionally, if a method might return null, you'd have to manually check for null before accessing the value:String name = getUserName(); // might return nullif (name != null) { System.out.println(name.length());} else { // handle null}If you forget that null check and call name.length(), boom üí• ‚Äî NullPointerException.‚úÖ The Solution: OptionalInstead of returning null, return an Optional<T>:Optional<String> name = getUserName(); // returns Optional<String>name.ifPresent(n -> System.out.println(n.length()));Or with a default value:String result = name.orElse("Default Name");Or throwing an exception intentionally:String result = name.orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Name not found"));üì¶ How Optional HelpsForces explicit handling of absence of value.Avoids accidental null dereference.Cleaner, more readable code than nested null checks.üö® When it MattersFor performance-critical code (e.g., tight loops, mobile), Optional might have a micro-performance hit.For clean code, API design, and readability, Optional is a clear win.hashtag#interview hashtag#java

**Job Posting: Live CCTV Video Streaming Developer** **Position:** Freelance/Contract Developer (Remote) **Project Duration:** [3‚Äì6 months] **Budget:** ["Negotiable"] ---### **About the Project** We‚Äôre building a mobile/web app to display live video feeds from CCTV cameras (IP-based) in real time. The goal is to integrate secure, low-latency streaming from cameras using protocols like RTSP, HLS, or WebRTC. The app will serve both Android and iOS users, with potential web integration. ---### **Responsibilities** 1. Design and implement a live video streaming system for CCTV camera feeds. 2. Integrate camera streams (RTSP, ONVIF, or HTTP/MJPEG) into the app with playback functionality. 3. Optimize latency, quality, and bandwidth usage for real-time viewing. 4. Ensure secure access (token-based authentication, VPN, HTTPS). 5. Set up a backend proxy/transcoding server (e.g., NGINX, FFmpeg) if required. 6. Collaborate with our team to troubleshoot and test across devices/networks. 7. Document the architecture and workflows. ---### **Required Skills** - **Video Streaming Expertise**:  - Protocols: RTSP, HLS, WebRTC, RTMP.  - Tools: FFmpeg, GStreamer, ExoPlayer (Android), AVPlayer (iOS), or WebRTC libraries. - **Mobile/Web Development**:  - Android (Kotlin/Java) and/or iOS (Swift) for mobile apps.  - Web: JavaScript, HLS.js, video.js, or WebRTC (React/Node.js). - **Backend/Server Skills** (if needed):  - Setting up proxy servers (NGINX RTMP, Node.js).  - Cloud services (AWS IVS, GCP) for transcoding/CDN. - **Security**: HTTPS, DRM, token authentication, firewall rules. - **Testing**: Latency optimization, codec troubleshooting (H.264/H.265). ---### **Preferred Qualifications** - Experience with CCTV/IP camera systems (e.g., ONVIF, Dahua, Hikvision). - Knowledge of IoT frameworks (e.g., AWS IoT Core). - Familiarity with analytics tools (Mux, Bitmovin). - Portfolio of similar live-streaming projects. ---### **Deliverables** 1. A working app with live CCTV feed integration. 2. Documentation for setup, maintenance, and API usage. 3. Optimized streaming pipeline with <2s latency (if possible). ---### **How to Apply** Submit your proposal with: - A brief cover letter explaining your approach to live streaming. - Examples of past projects (GitHub, demos, or case studies). - Hourly rate or project-based quote. **Contact:** [muneebumughal@gmail.com] ---### **Why Work With Us?** - Opportunity to shape a scalable video surveillance solution. - Flexible remote work with a collaborative team.

ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêØùê¢ùêûùê∞ ùêêùêÆùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß : ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ ùêéùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùê°ùêûùê•ùê© ùê¢ùêß ùêöùêØùê®ùê¢ùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêçùêÆùê•ùê•ùêèùê®ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêÑùê±ùêúùêûùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß? ‚úÖ Traditionally, if a method might return null, you'd have to manually check for null before accessing the value:String name = getUserName(); // might return nullif (name != null) { System.out.println(name.length());} else { // handle null}If you forget that null check and call name.length(), boom üí• ‚Äî NullPointerException.‚úÖ The Solution: OptionalInstead of returning null, return an Optional<T>:Optional<String> name = getUserName(); // returns Optional<String>name.ifPresent(n -> System.out.println(n.length()));Or with a default value:String result = name.orElse("Default Name");Or throwing an exception intentionally:String result = name.orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Name not found"));üì¶ How Optional HelpsForces explicit handling of absence of value.Avoids accidental null dereference.Cleaner, more readable code than nested null checks.üö® When it MattersFor performance-critical code (e.g., tight loops, mobile), Optional might have a micro-performance hit.For clean code, API design, and readability, Optional is a clear win.hashtag#interview hashtag#java

The goal is to integrate secure, low-latency streaming from cameras using protocols like RTSP, HLS, or WebRTC. The app will serve both Android and iOS users, with potential web integration. ---### **Responsibilities** 1. Design and implement a live video streaming system for CCTV camera feeds. 2. Integrate camera streams (RTSP, ONVIF, or HTTP/MJPEG) into the app with playback functionality. 3. Optimize latency, quality, and bandwidth usage for real-time viewing. 4. Ensure secure access (token-based authentication, VPN, HTTPS). 5. Set up a backend proxy/transcoding server (e.g., NGINX, FFmpeg) if required. 6. Collaborate with our team to troubleshoot and test across devices/networks. 7. Document the architecture and workflows. ---### **Required Skills** - **Video Streaming Expertise**:  - Protocols: RTSP, HLS, WebRTC, RTMP.  - Tools: FFmpeg, GStreamer, ExoPlayer (Android), AVPlayer (iOS), or WebRTC libraries. - **Mobile/Web Development**:  - Android (Kotlin/Java) and/or iOS (Swift) for mobile apps.  - Web: JavaScript, HLS.js, video.js, or WebRTC (React/Node.js). - **Backend/Server Skills** (if needed):  - Setting up proxy servers (NGINX RTMP, Node.js).  - Cloud services (AWS IVS, GCP) for transcoding/CDN. - **Security**: HTTPS, DRM, token authentication, firewall rules. - **Testing**: Latency optimization, codec troubleshooting (H.264/H.265). ---### **Preferred Qualifications** - Experience with CCTV/IP camera systems (e.g., ONVIF, Dahua, Hikvision). - Knowledge of IoT frameworks (e.g., AWS IoT Core). - Familiarity with analytics tools (Mux, Bitmovin). - Portfolio of similar live-streaming projects. ---### **Deliverables** 1. A working app with live CCTV feed integration. 2. Documentation for setup, maintenance, and API usage. 3. Optimized streaming pipeline with <2s latency (if possible). ---### **How to Apply** Submit your proposal with: - A brief cover letter explaining your approach to live streaming. - Examples of past projects (GitHub, demos, or case studies). - Hourly rate or project-based quote. **Contact:** [muneebumughal@gmail.com] ---### **Why Work With Us?** - Opportunity to shape a scalable video surveillance solution. - Flexible remote work with a collaborative team.

ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêØùê¢ùêûùê∞ ùêêùêÆùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß : ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ ùêéùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùê°ùêûùê•ùê© ùê¢ùêß ùêöùêØùê®ùê¢ùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêçùêÆùê•ùê•ùêèùê®ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêÑùê±ùêúùêûùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß? ‚úÖ Traditionally, if a method might return null, you'd have to manually check for null before accessing the value:String name = getUserName(); // might return nullif (name != null) { System.out.println(name.length());} else { // handle null}If you forget that null check and call name.length(), boom üí• ‚Äî NullPointerException.‚úÖ The Solution: OptionalInstead of returning null, return an Optional<T>:Optional<String> name = getUserName(); // returns Optional<String>name.ifPresent(n -> System.out.println(n.length()));Or with a default value:String result = name.orElse("Default Name");Or throwing an exception intentionally:String result = name.orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Name not found"));üì¶ How Optional HelpsForces explicit handling of absence of value.Avoids accidental null dereference.Cleaner, more readable code than nested null checks.üö® When it MattersFor performance-critical code (e.g., tight loops, mobile), Optional might have a micro-performance hit.For clean code, API design, and readability, Optional is a clear win.hashtag#interview hashtag#java

**Job Posting: Live CCTV Video Streaming Developer** **Position:** Freelance/Contract Developer (Remote) **Project Duration:** [3‚Äì6 months] **Budget:** ["Negotiable"] ---### **About the Project** We‚Äôre building a mobile/web app to display live video feeds from CCTV cameras (IP-based) in real time. The goal is to integrate secure, low-latency streaming from cameras using protocols like RTSP, HLS, or WebRTC. The app will serve both Android and iOS users, with potential web integration. ---### **Responsibilities** 1. Design and implement a live video streaming system for CCTV camera feeds. 2. Integrate camera streams (RTSP, ONVIF, or HTTP/MJPEG) into the app with playback functionality. 3. Optimize latency, quality, and bandwidth usage for real-time viewing. 4. Ensure secure access (token-based authentication, VPN, HTTPS). 5. Set up a backend proxy/transcoding server (e.g., NGINX, FFmpeg) if required. 6. Collaborate with our team to troubleshoot and test across devices/networks. 7. Document the architecture and workflows. ---### **Required Skills** - **Video Streaming Expertise**:  - Protocols: RTSP, HLS, WebRTC, RTMP.  - Tools: FFmpeg, GStreamer, ExoPlayer (Android), AVPlayer (iOS), or WebRTC libraries. - **Mobile/Web Development**:  - Android (Kotlin/Java) and/or iOS (Swift) for mobile apps.  - Web: JavaScript, HLS.js, video.js, or WebRTC (React/Node.js). - **Backend/Server Skills** (if needed):  - Setting up proxy servers (NGINX RTMP, Node.js).  - Cloud services (AWS IVS, GCP) for transcoding/CDN. - **Security**: HTTPS, DRM, token authentication, firewall rules. - **Testing**: Latency optimization, codec troubleshooting (H.264/H.265). ---### **Preferred Qualifications** - Experience with CCTV/IP camera systems (e.g., ONVIF, Dahua, Hikvision). - Knowledge of IoT frameworks (e.g., AWS IoT Core). - Familiarity with analytics tools (Mux, Bitmovin). - Portfolio of similar live-streaming projects. ---### **Deliverables** 1. A working app with live CCTV feed integration. 2. Documentation for setup, maintenance, and API usage. 3. Optimized streaming pipeline with <2s latency (if possible). ---### **How to Apply** Submit your proposal with: - A brief cover letter explaining your approach to live streaming. - Examples of past projects (GitHub, demos, or case studies). - Hourly rate or project-based quote. **Contact:** [muneebumughal@gmail.com] ---### **Why Work With Us?** - Opportunity to shape a scalable video surveillance solution. - Flexible remote work with a collaborative team.

ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêØùê¢ùêûùê∞ ùêêùêÆùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß : ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ ùêéùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùê°ùêûùê•ùê© ùê¢ùêß ùêöùêØùê®ùê¢ùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêçùêÆùê•ùê•ùêèùê®ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêÑùê±ùêúùêûùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß? ‚úÖ Traditionally, if a method might return null, you'd have to manually check for null before accessing the value:String name = getUserName(); // might return nullif (name != null) { System.out.println(name.length());} else { // handle null}If you forget that null check and call name.length(), boom üí• ‚Äî NullPointerException.‚úÖ The Solution: OptionalInstead of returning null, return an Optional<T>:Optional<String> name = getUserName(); // returns Optional<String>name.ifPresent(n -> System.out.println(n.length()));Or with a default value:String result = name.orElse("Default Name");Or throwing an exception intentionally:String result = name.orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Name not found"));üì¶ How Optional HelpsForces explicit handling of absence of value.Avoids accidental null dereference.Cleaner, more readable code than nested null checks.üö® When it MattersFor performance-critical code (e.g., tight loops, mobile), Optional might have a micro-performance hit.For clean code, API design, and readability, Optional is a clear win.hashtag#interview hashtag#java

**Job Posting: Live CCTV Video Streaming Developer** **Position:** Freelance/Contract Developer (Remote) **Project Duration:** [3‚Äì6 months] **Budget:** ["Negotiable"] ---### **About the Project** We‚Äôre building a mobile/web app to display live video feeds from CCTV cameras (IP-based) in real time. The goal is to integrate secure, low-latency streaming from cameras using protocols like RTSP, HLS, or WebRTC. The app will serve both Android and iOS users, with potential web integration. ---### **Responsibilities** 1. Design and implement a live video streaming system for CCTV camera feeds. 2. Integrate camera streams (RTSP, ONVIF, or HTTP/MJPEG) into the app with playback functionality. 3. Optimize latency, quality, and bandwidth usage for real-time viewing. 4. Ensure secure access (token-based authentication, VPN, HTTPS). 5. Set up a backend proxy/transcoding server (e.g., NGINX, FFmpeg) if required. 6. Collaborate with our team to troubleshoot and test across devices/networks. 7. Document the architecture and workflows. ---### **Required Skills** - **Video Streaming Expertise**:  - Protocols: RTSP, HLS, WebRTC, RTMP.  - Tools: FFmpeg, GStreamer, ExoPlayer (Android), AVPlayer (iOS), or WebRTC libraries. - **Mobile/Web Development**:  - Android (Kotlin/Java) and/or iOS (Swift) for mobile apps.  - Web: JavaScript, HLS.js, video.js, or WebRTC (React/Node.js). - **Backend/Server Skills** (if needed):  - Setting up proxy servers (NGINX RTMP, Node.js).  - Cloud services (AWS IVS, GCP) for transcoding/CDN. - **Security**: HTTPS, DRM, token authentication, firewall rules. - **Testing**: Latency optimization, codec troubleshooting (H.264/H.265). ---### **Preferred Qualifications** - Experience with CCTV/IP camera systems (e.g., ONVIF, Dahua, Hikvision). - Knowledge of IoT frameworks (e.g., AWS IoT Core). - Familiarity with analytics tools (Mux, Bitmovin). - Portfolio of similar live-streaming projects. ---### **Deliverables** 1. ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêØùê¢ùêûùê∞ ùêêùêÆùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß : ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ ùêéùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùê°ùêûùê•ùê© ùê¢ùêß ùêöùêØùê®ùê¢ùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêçùêÆùê•ùê•ùêèùê®ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêÑùê±ùêúùêûùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß? ‚úÖ Traditionally, if a method might return null, you'd have to manually check for null before accessing the value:String name = getUserName(); // might return nullif (name != null) { System.out.println(name.length());} else { // handle null}If you forget that null check and call name.length(), boom üí• ‚Äî NullPointerException.‚úÖ The Solution: OptionalInstead of returning null, return an Optional<T>:Optional<String> name = getUserName(); // returns Optional<String>name.ifPresent(n -> System.out.println(n.length()));Or with a default value:String result = name.orElse("Default Name");Or throwing an exception intentionally:String result = name.orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Name not found"));üì¶ How Optional HelpsForces explicit handling of absence of value.Avoids accidental null dereference.Cleaner, more readable code than nested null checks.üö® When it MattersFor performance-critical code (e.g., tight loops, mobile), Optional might have a micro-performance hit.For clean code, API design, and readability, Optional is a clear win.hashtag#interview hashtag#java

**Job Posting: Live CCTV Video Streaming Developer** **Position:** Freelance/Contract Developer (Remote) **Project Duration:** [3‚Äì6 months] **Budget:** ["Negotiable"] ---### **About the Project** We‚Äôre building a mobile/web app to display live video feeds from CCTV cameras (IP-based) in real time. The goal is to integrate secure, low-latency streaming from cameras using protocols like RTSP, HLS, or WebRTC. The app will serve both Android and iOS users, with potential web integration. ---### **Responsibilities** 1. Design and implement a live video streaming system for CCTV camera feeds. 2. Integrate camera streams (RTSP, ONVIF, or HTTP/MJPEG) into the app with playback functionality. 3. Optimize latency, quality, and bandwidth usage for real-time viewing. 4. Ensure secure access (token-based authentication, VPN, HTTPS). 5. Set up a backend proxy/transcoding server (e.g., NGINX, FFmpeg) if required. 6. Collaborate with our team to troubleshoot and test across devices/networks. 7. Document the architecture and workflows. ---### **Required Skills** - **Video Streaming Expertise**:  - Protocols: RTSP, HLS, WebRTC, RTMP.  - Tools: FFmpeg, GStreamer, ExoPlayer (Android), AVPlayer (iOS), or WebRTC libraries. - **Mobile/Web Development**:  - Android (Kotlin/Java) and/or iOS (Swift) for mobile apps.  - Web: JavaScript, HLS.js, video.js, or WebRTC (React/Node.js). - **Backend/Server Skills** (if needed):  - Setting up proxy servers (NGINX RTMP, Node.js).  - Cloud services (AWS IVS, GCP) for transcoding/CDN. - **Security**: HTTPS, DRM, token authentication, firewall rules. - **Testing**: Latency optimization, codec troubleshooting (H.264/H.265). ---### **Preferred Qualifications** - Experience with CCTV/IP camera systems (e.g., ONVIF, Dahua, Hikvision). - Knowledge of IoT frameworks (e.g., AWS IoT Core). - Familiarity with analytics tools (Mux, Bitmovin). - Portfolio of similar live-streaming projects. ---### **Deliverables** 1. A working app with live CCTV feed integration. 2. Documentation for setup, maintenance, and API usage. 3. Optimized streaming pipeline with <2s latency (if possible). ---### **How to Apply** Submit your proposal with: - A brief cover letter explaining your approach to live streaming. - Examples of past projects (GitHub, demos, or case studies). - Hourly rate or project-based quote. **Contact:** [muneebumughal@gmail.com] ---### **Why Work With Us?** - Opportunity to shape a scalable video surveillance solution. - Flexible remote work with a collaborative team.

ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêØùê¢ùêûùê∞ ùêêùêÆùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß : ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ ùêéùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùê°ùêûùê•ùê© ùê¢ùêß ùêöùêØùê®ùê¢ùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêçùêÆùê•ùê•ùêèùê®ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêÑùê±ùêúùêûùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß? ‚úÖ Traditionally, if a method might return null, you'd have to manually check for null before accessing the value:String name = getUserName(); // might return nullif (name != null) { System.out.println(name.length());} else { // handle null}If you forget that null check and call name.length(), boom üí• ‚Äî NullPointerException.‚úÖ The Solution: OptionalInstead of returning null, return an Optional<T>:Optional<String> name = getUserName(); // returns Optional<String>name.ifPresent(n -> System.out.println(n.length()));Or with a default value:String result = name.orElse("Default Name");Or throwing an exception intentionally:String result = name.orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Name not found"));üì¶ How Optional HelpsForces explicit handling of absence of value.Avoids accidental null dereference.Cleaner, more readable code than nested null checks.üö® When it MattersFor performance-critical code (e.g., tight loops, mobile), Optional might have a micro-performance hit.For clean code, API design, and readability, Optional is a clear win.hashtag#interview hashtag#java

The goal is to integrate secure, low-latency streaming from cameras using protocols like RTSP, HLS, or WebRTC. The app will serve both Android and iOS users, with potential web integration. ---### **Responsibilities** 1. Design and implement a live video streaming system for CCTV camera feeds. 2. Integrate camera streams (RTSP, ONVIF, or HTTP/MJPEG) into the app with playback functionality. 3. Optimize latency, quality, and bandwidth usage for real-time viewing. 4. Ensure secure access (token-based authentication, VPN, HTTPS). 5. Set up a backend proxy/transcoding server (e.g., NGINX, FFmpeg) if required. 6. Collaborate with our team to troubleshoot and test across devices/networks. 7. Document the architecture and workflows. ---### **Required Skills** - **Video Streaming Expertise**:  - Protocols: RTSP, HLS, WebRTC, RTMP.  - Tools: FFmpeg, GStreamer, ExoPlayer (Android), AVPlayer (iOS), or WebRTC libraries. - **Mobile/Web Development**:  - Android (Kotlin/Java) and/or iOS (Swift) for mobile apps.  - Web: JavaScript, HLS.js, video.js, or WebRTC (React/Node.js). - **Backend/Server Skills** (if needed):  - Setting up proxy servers (NGINX RTMP, Node.js).  - Cloud services (AWS IVS, GCP) for transcoding/CDN. - **Security**: HTTPS, DRM, token authentication, firewall rules. - **Testing**: Latency optimization, codec troubleshooting (H.264/H.265). ---### **Preferred Qualifications** - Experience with CCTV/IP camera systems (e.g., ONVIF, Dahua, Hikvision). - Knowledge of IoT frameworks (e.g., AWS IoT Core). - Familiarity with analytics tools (Mux, Bitmovin). - Portfolio of similar live-streaming projects. ---### **Deliverables** 1. A working app with live CCTV feed integration. 2. Documentation for setup, maintenance, and API usage. 3. Optimized streaming pipeline with <2s latency (if possible). ---### **How to Apply** Submit your proposal with: - A brief cover letter explaining your approach to live streaming. - Examples of past projects (GitHub, demos, or case studies). - Hourly rate or project-based quote. **Contact:** [muneebumughal@gmail.com] ---### **Why Work With Us?** - Opportunity to shape a scalable video surveillance solution. - Flexible remote work with a collaborative team.

ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêØùê¢ùêûùê∞ ùêêùêÆùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß : ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ ùêéùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùê°ùêûùê•ùê© ùê¢ùêß ùêöùêØùê®ùê¢ùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêçùêÆùê•ùê•ùêèùê®ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêÑùê±ùêúùêûùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß? ‚úÖ Traditionally, if a method might return null, you'd have to manually check for null before accessing the value:String name = getUserName(); // might return nullif (name != null) { System.out.println(name.length());} else { // handle null}If you forget that null check and call name.length(), boom üí• ‚Äî NullPointerException.‚úÖ The Solution: OptionalInstead of returning null, return an Optional<T>:Optional<String> name = getUserName(); // returns Optional<String>name.ifPresent(n -> System.out.println(n.length()));Or with a default value:String result = name.orElse("Default Name");Or throwing an exception intentionally:String result = name.orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Name not found"));üì¶ How Optional HelpsForces explicit handling of absence of value.Avoids accidental null dereference.Cleaner, more readable code than nested null checks.üö® When it MattersFor performance-critical code (e.g., tight loops, mobile), Optional might have a micro-performance hit.For clean code, API design, and readability, Optional is a clear win.hashtag#interview hashtag#java

**Job Posting: Live CCTV Video Streaming Developer** **Position:** Freelance/Contract Developer (Remote) **Project Duration:** [3‚Äì6 months] **Budget:** ["Negotiable"] ---### **About the Project** We‚Äôre building a mobile/web app to display live video feeds from CCTV cameras (IP-based) in real time. The goal is to integrate secure, low-latency streaming from cameras using protocols like RTSP, HLS, or WebRTC. The app will serve both Android and iOS users, with potential web integration. ---### **Responsibilities** 1. Design and implement a live video streaming system for CCTV camera feeds. 2. Integrate camera streams (RTSP, ONVIF, or HTTP/MJPEG) into the app with playback functionality. 3. Optimize latency, quality, and bandwidth usage for real-time viewing. 4. Ensure secure access (token-based authentication, VPN, HTTPS). 5. Set up a backend proxy/transcoding server (e.g., NGINX, FFmpeg) if required. 6. Collaborate with our team to troubleshoot and test across devices/networks. 7. Document the architecture and workflows. ---### **Required Skills** - **Video Streaming Expertise**:  - Protocols: RTSP, HLS, WebRTC, RTMP.  - Tools: FFmpeg, GStreamer, ExoPlayer (Android), AVPlayer (iOS), or WebRTC libraries. - **Mobile/Web Development**:  - Android (Kotlin/Java) and/or iOS (Swift) for mobile apps.  - Web: JavaScript, HLS.js, video.js, or WebRTC (React/Node.js). - **Backend/Server Skills** (if needed):  - Setting up proxy servers (NGINX RTMP, Node.js).  - Cloud services (AWS IVS, GCP) for transcoding/CDN. - **Security**: HTTPS, DRM, token authentication, firewall rules. - **Testing**: Latency optimization, codec troubleshooting (H.264/H.265). ---### **Preferred Qualifications** - Experience with CCTV/IP camera systems (e.g., ONVIF, Dahua, Hikvision). - Knowledge of IoT frameworks (e.g., AWS IoT Core). - Familiarity with analytics tools (Mux, Bitmovin). - Portfolio of similar live-streaming projects. ---### **Deliverables** 1. A working app with live CCTV feed integration. 2. Documentation for setup, maintenance, and API usage. 3. Optimized streaming pipeline with <2s latency (if possible). ---### **How to Apply** Submit your proposal with: - A brief cover letter explaining your approach to live streaming. - Examples of past projects (GitHub, demos, or case studies). - Hourly rate or project-based quote. **Contact:** [muneebumughal@gmail.com] ---### **Why Work With Us?** - Opportunity to shape a scalable video surveillance solution. - Flexible remote work with a collaborative team.

ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêØùê¢ùêûùê∞ ùêêùêÆùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß : ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ ùêéùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùê°ùêûùê•ùê© ùê¢ùêß ùêöùêØùê®ùê¢ùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêçùêÆùê•ùê•ùêèùê®ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêÑùê±ùêúùêûùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß? ‚úÖ Traditionally, if a method might return null, you'd have to manually check for null before accessing the value:String name = getUserName(); // might return nullif (name != null) { System.out.println(name.length());} else { // handle null}If you forget that null check and call name.length(), boom üí• ‚Äî NullPointerException.‚úÖ The Solution: OptionalInstead of returning null, return an Optional<T>:Optional<String> name = getUserName(); // returns Optional<String>name.ifPresent(n -> System.out.println(n.length()));Or with a default value:String result = name.orElse("Default Name");Or throwing an exception intentionally:String result = name.orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Name not found"));üì¶ How Optional HelpsForces explicit handling of absence of value.Avoids accidental null dereference.Cleaner, more readable code than nested null checks.üö® When it MattersFor performance-critical code (e.g., tight loops, mobile), Optional might have a micro-performance hit.For clean code, API design, and readability, Optional is a clear win.hashtag#interview hashtag#java

**Job Posting: Live CCTV Video Streaming Developer** **Position:** Freelance/Contract Developer (Remote) **Project Duration:** [3‚Äì6 months] **Budget:** ["Negotiable"] ---### **About the Project** We‚Äôre building a mobile/web app to display live video feeds from CCTV cameras (IP-based) in real time. The goal is to integrate secure, low-latency streaming from cameras using protocols like RTSP, HLS, or WebRTC. The app will serve both Android and iOS users, with potential web integration. ---### **Responsibilities** 1. Design and implement a live video streaming system for CCTV camera feeds. 2. Integrate camera streams (RTSP, ONVIF, or HTTP/MJPEG) into the app with playback functionality. 3. Optimize latency, quality, and bandwidth usage for real-time viewing. 4. Ensure secure access (token-based authentication, VPN, HTTPS). 5. Set up a backend proxy/transcoding server (e.g., NGINX, FFmpeg) if required. 6. Collaborate with our team to troubleshoot and test across devices/networks. 7. Document the architecture and workflows. ---### **Required Skills** - **Video Streaming Expertise**:  - Protocols: RTSP, HLS, WebRTC, RTMP.  - Tools: FFmpeg, GStreamer, ExoPlayer (Android), AVPlayer (iOS), or WebRTC libraries. - **Mobile/Web Development**:  - Android (Kotlin/Java) and/or iOS (Swift) for mobile apps.  - Web: JavaScript, HLS.js, video.js, or WebRTC (React/Node.js). - **Backend/Server Skills** (if needed):  - Setting up proxy servers (NGINX RTMP, Node.js).  - Cloud services (AWS IVS, GCP) for transcoding/CDN. - **Security**: HTTPS, DRM, token authentication, firewall rules. - **Testing**: Latency optimization, codec troubleshooting (H.264/H.265). ---### **Preferred Qualifications** - Experience with CCTV/IP camera systems (e.g., ONVIF, Dahua, Hikvision). - Knowledge of IoT frameworks (e.g., AWS IoT Core). - Familiarity with analytics tools (Mux, Bitmovin). - Portfolio of similar live-streaming projects. ---### **Deliverables** 1. ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêØùê¢ùêûùê∞ ùêêùêÆùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß : ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ ùêéùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùê°ùêûùê•ùê© ùê¢ùêß ùêöùêØùê®ùê¢ùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêçùêÆùê•ùê•ùêèùê®ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêÑùê±ùêúùêûùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß? ‚úÖ Traditionally, if a method might return null, you'd have to manually check for null before accessing the value:String name = getUserName(); // might return nullif (name != null) { System.out.println(name.length());} else { // handle null}If you forget that null check and call name.length(), boom üí• ‚Äî NullPointerException.‚úÖ The Solution: OptionalInstead of returning null, return an Optional<T>:Optional<String> name = getUserName(); // returns Optional<String>name.ifPresent(n -> System.out.println(n.length()));Or with a default value:String result = name.orElse("Default Name");Or throwing an exception intentionally:String result = name.orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Name not found"));üì¶ How Optional HelpsForces explicit handling of absence of value.Avoids accidental null dereference.Cleaner, more readable code than nested null checks.üö® When it MattersFor performance-critical code (e.g., tight loops, mobile), Optional might have a micro-performance hit.For clean code, API design, and readability, Optional is a clear win.hashtag#interview hashtag#java

**Job Posting: Live CCTV Video Streaming Developer** **Position:** Freelance/Contract Developer (Remote) **Project Duration:** [3‚Äì6 months] **Budget:** ["Negotiable"] ---### **About the Project** We‚Äôre building a mobile/web app to display live video feeds from CCTV cameras (IP-based) in real time. The goal is to integrate secure, low-latency streaming from cameras using protocols like RTSP, HLS, or WebRTC. The app will serve both Android and iOS users, with potential web integration. ---### **Responsibilities** 1. Design and implement a live video streaming system for CCTV camera feeds. 2. Integrate camera streams (RTSP, ONVIF, or HTTP/MJPEG) into the app with playback functionality. 3. Optimize latency, quality, and bandwidth usage for real-time viewing. 4. Ensure secure access (token-based authentication, VPN, HTTPS). 5. Set up a backend proxy/transcoding server (e.g., NGINX, FFmpeg) if required. 6. Collaborate with our team to troubleshoot and test across devices/networks. 7. Document the architecture and workflows. ---### **Required Skills** - **Video Streaming Expertise**:  - Protocols: RTSP, HLS, WebRTC, RTMP.  - Tools: FFmpeg, GStreamer, ExoPlayer (Android), AVPlayer (iOS), or WebRTC libraries. - **Mobile/Web Development**:  - Android (Kotlin/Java) and/or iOS (Swift) for mobile apps.  - Web: JavaScript, HLS.js, video.js, or WebRTC (React/Node.js). - **Backend/Server Skills** (if needed):  - Setting up proxy servers (NGINX RTMP, Node.js).  - Cloud services (AWS IVS, GCP) for transcoding/CDN. - **Security**: HTTPS, DRM, token authentication, firewall rules. - **Testing**: Latency optimization, codec troubleshooting (H.264/H.265). ---### **Preferred Qualifications** - Experience with CCTV/IP camera systems (e.g., ONVIF, Dahua, Hikvision). - Knowledge of IoT frameworks (e.g., AWS IoT Core). - Familiarity with analytics tools (Mux, Bitmovin). - Portfolio of similar live-streaming projects. ---### **Deliverables** 1. A working app with live CCTV feed integration. 2. Documentation for setup, maintenance, and API usage. 3. Optimized streaming pipeline with <2s latency (if possible). ---### **How to Apply** Submit your proposal with: - A brief cover letter explaining your approach to live streaming. - Examples of past projects (GitHub, demos, or case studies). - Hourly rate or project-based quote. **Contact:** [muneebumughal@gmail.com] ---### **Why Work With Us?** - Opportunity to shape a scalable video surveillance solution. - Flexible remote work with a collaborative team.

ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêØùê¢ùêûùê∞ ùêêùêÆùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß : ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ ùêéùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùê°ùêûùê•ùê© ùê¢ùêß ùêöùêØùê®ùê¢ùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêçùêÆùê•ùê•ùêèùê®ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêÑùê±ùêúùêûùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß? ‚úÖ Traditionally, if a method might return null, you'd have to manually check for null before accessing the value:String name = getUserName(); // might return nullif (name != null) { System.out.println(name.length());} else { // handle null}If you forget that null check and call name.length(), boom üí• ‚Äî NullPointerException.‚úÖ The Solution: OptionalInstead of returning null, return an Optional<T>:Optional<String> name = getUserName(); // returns Optional<String>name.ifPresent(n -> System.out.println(n.length()));Or with a default value:String result = name.orElse("Default Name");Or throwing an exception intentionally:String result = name.orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Name not found"));üì¶ How Optional HelpsForces explicit handling of absence of value.Avoids accidental null dereference.Cleaner, more readable code than nested null checks.üö® When it MattersFor performance-critical code (e.g., tight loops, mobile), Optional might have a micro-performance hit.For clean code, API design, and readability, Optional is a clear win.hashtag#interview hashtag#java

The goal is to integrate secure, low-latency streaming from cameras using protocols like RTSP, HLS, or WebRTC. The app will serve both Android and iOS users, with potential web integration. ---### **Responsibilities** 1. Design and implement a live video streaming system for CCTV camera feeds. 2. Integrate camera streams (RTSP, ONVIF, or HTTP/MJPEG) into the app with playback functionality. 3. Optimize latency, quality, and bandwidth usage for real-time viewing. 4. Ensure secure access (token-based authentication, VPN, HTTPS). 5. Set up a backend proxy/transcoding server (e.g., NGINX, FFmpeg) if required. 6. Collaborate with our team to troubleshoot and test across devices/networks. 7. Document the architecture and workflows. ---### **Required Skills** - **Video Streaming Expertise**:  - Protocols: RTSP, HLS, WebRTC, RTMP.  - Tools: FFmpeg, GStreamer, ExoPlayer (Android), AVPlayer (iOS), or WebRTC libraries. - **Mobile/Web Development**:  - Android (Kotlin/Java) and/or iOS (Swift) for mobile apps.  - Web: JavaScript, HLS.js, video.js, or WebRTC (React/Node.js). - **Backend/Server Skills** (if needed):  - Setting up proxy servers (NGINX RTMP, Node.js).  - Cloud services (AWS IVS, GCP) for transcoding/CDN. - **Security**: HTTPS, DRM, token authentication, firewall rules. - **Testing**: Latency optimization, codec troubleshooting (H.264/H.265). ---### **Preferred Qualifications** - Experience with CCTV/IP camera systems (e.g., ONVIF, Dahua, Hikvision). - Knowledge of IoT frameworks (e.g., AWS IoT Core). - Familiarity with analytics tools (Mux, Bitmovin). - Portfolio of similar live-streaming projects. ---### **Deliverables** 1. A working app with live CCTV feed integration. 2. Documentation for setup, maintenance, and API usage. 3. Optimized streaming pipeline with <2s latency (if possible). ---### **How to Apply** Submit your proposal with: - A brief cover letter explaining your approach to live streaming. - Examples of past projects (GitHub, demos, or case studies). - Hourly rate or project-based quote. **Contact:** [muneebumughal@gmail.com] ---### **Why Work With Us?** - Opportunity to shape a scalable video surveillance solution. - Flexible remote work with a collaborative team.

ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêØùê¢ùêûùê∞ ùêêùêÆùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß : ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ ùêéùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùê°ùêûùê•ùê© ùê¢ùêß ùêöùêØùê®ùê¢ùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêçùêÆùê•ùê•ùêèùê®ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêÑùê±ùêúùêûùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß? ‚úÖ Traditionally, if a method might return null, you'd have to manually check for null before accessing the value:String name = getUserName(); // might return nullif (name != null) { System.out.println(name.length());} else { // handle null}If you forget that null check and call name.length(), boom üí• ‚Äî NullPointerException.‚úÖ The Solution: OptionalInstead of returning null, return an Optional<T>:Optional<String> name = getUserName(); // returns Optional<String>name.ifPresent(n -> System.out.println(n.length()));Or with a default value:String result = name.orElse("Default Name");Or throwing an exception intentionally:String result = name.orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Name not found"));üì¶ How Optional HelpsForces explicit handling of absence of value.Avoids accidental null dereference.Cleaner, more readable code than nested null checks.üö® When it MattersFor performance-critical code (e.g., tight loops, mobile), Optional might have a micro-performance hit.For clean code, API design, and readability, Optional is a clear win.hashtag#interview hashtag#java

**Job Posting: Live CCTV Video Streaming Developer** **Position:** Freelance/Contract Developer (Remote) **Project Duration:** [3‚Äì6 months] **Budget:** ["Negotiable"] ---### **About the Project** We‚Äôre building a mobile/web app to display live video feeds from CCTV cameras (IP-based) in real time. The goal is to integrate secure, low-latency streaming from cameras using protocols like RTSP, HLS, or WebRTC. The app will serve both Android and iOS users, with potential web integration. ---### **Responsibilities** 1. Design and implement a live video streaming system for CCTV camera feeds. 2. Integrate camera streams (RTSP, ONVIF, or HTTP/MJPEG) into the app with playback functionality. 3. Optimize latency, quality, and bandwidth usage for real-time viewing. 4. Ensure secure access (token-based authentication, VPN, HTTPS). 5. Set up a backend proxy/transcoding server (e.g., NGINX, FFmpeg) if required. 6. Collaborate with our team to troubleshoot and test across devices/networks. 7. Document the architecture and workflows. ---### **Required Skills** - **Video Streaming Expertise**:  - Protocols: RTSP, HLS, WebRTC, RTMP.  - Tools: FFmpeg, GStreamer, ExoPlayer (Android), AVPlayer (iOS), or WebRTC libraries. - **Mobile/Web Development**:  - Android (Kotlin/Java) and/or iOS (Swift) for mobile apps.  - Web: JavaScript, HLS.js, video.js, or WebRTC (React/Node.js). - **Backend/Server Skills** (if needed):  - Setting up proxy servers (NGINX RTMP, Node.js).  - Cloud services (AWS IVS, GCP) for transcoding/CDN. - **Security**: HTTPS, DRM, token authentication, firewall rules. - **Testing**: Latency optimization, codec troubleshooting (H.264/H.265). ---### **Preferred Qualifications** - Experience with CCTV/IP camera systems (e.g., ONVIF, Dahua, Hikvision). - Knowledge of IoT frameworks (e.g., AWS IoT Core). - Familiarity with analytics tools (Mux, Bitmovin). - Portfolio of similar live-streaming projects. ---### **Deliverables** 1. A working app with live CCTV feed integration. 2. Documentation for setup, maintenance, and API usage. 3. Optimized streaming pipeline with <2s latency (if possible). ---### **How to Apply** Submit your proposal with: - A brief cover letter explaining your approach to live streaming. - Examples of past projects (GitHub, demos, or case studies). - Hourly rate or project-based quote. **Contact:** [muneebumughal@gmail.com] ---### **Why Work With Us?** - Opportunity to shape a scalable video surveillance solution. - Flexible remote work with a collaborative team.

ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêØùê¢ùêûùê∞ ùêêùêÆùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß : ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ ùêéùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùê°ùêûùê•ùê© ùê¢ùêß ùêöùêØùê®ùê¢ùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêçùêÆùê•ùê•ùêèùê®ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêÑùê±ùêúùêûùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß? ‚úÖ Traditionally, if a method might return null, you'd have to manually check for null before accessing the value:String name = getUserName(); // might return nullif (name != null) { System.out.println(name.length());} else { // handle null}If you forget that null check and call name.length(), boom üí• ‚Äî NullPointerException.‚úÖ The Solution: OptionalInstead of returning null, return an Optional<T>:Optional<String> name = getUserName(); // returns Optional<String>name.ifPresent(n -> System.out.println(n.length()));Or with a default value:String result = name.orElse("Default Name");Or throwing an exception intentionally:String result = name.orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Name not found"));üì¶ How Optional HelpsForces explicit handling of absence of value.Avoids accidental null dereference.Cleaner, more readable code than nested null checks.üö® When it MattersFor performance-critical code (e.g., tight loops, mobile), Optional might have a micro-performance hit.For clean code, API design, and readability, Optional is a clear win.hashtag#interview hashtag#java

**Job Posting: Live CCTV Video Streaming Developer** **Position:** Freelance/Contract Developer (Remote) **Project Duration:** [3‚Äì6 months] **Budget:** ["Negotiable"] ---### **About the Project** We‚Äôre building a mobile/web app to display live video feeds from CCTV cameras (IP-based) in real time. The goal is to integrate secure, low-latency streaming from cameras using protocols like RTSP, HLS, or WebRTC. The app will serve both Android and iOS users, with potential web integration. ---### **Responsibilities** 1. Design and implement a live video streaming system for CCTV camera feeds. 2. Integrate camera streams (RTSP, ONVIF, or HTTP/MJPEG) into the app with playback functionality. 3. Optimize latency, quality, and bandwidth usage for real-time viewing. 4. Ensure secure access (token-based authentication, VPN, HTTPS). 5. Set up a backend proxy/transcoding server (e.g., NGINX, FFmpeg) if required. 6. Collaborate with our team to troubleshoot and test across devices/networks. 7. Document the architecture and workflows. ---### **Required Skills** - **Video Streaming Expertise**:  - Protocols: RTSP, HLS, WebRTC, RTMP.  - Tools: FFmpeg, GStreamer, ExoPlayer (Android), AVPlayer (iOS), or WebRTC libraries. - **Mobile/Web Development**:  - Android (Kotlin/Java) and/or iOS (Swift) for mobile apps.  - Web: JavaScript, HLS.js, video.js, or WebRTC (React/Node.js). - **Backend/Server Skills** (if needed):  - Setting up proxy servers (NGINX RTMP, Node.js).  - Cloud services (AWS IVS, GCP) for transcoding/CDN. - **Security**: HTTPS, DRM, token authentication, firewall rules. - **Testing**: Latency optimization, codec troubleshooting (H.264/H.265). ---### **Preferred Qualifications** - Experience with CCTV/IP camera systems (e.g., ONVIF, Dahua, Hikvision). - Knowledge of IoT frameworks (e.g., AWS IoT Core). - Familiarity with analytics tools (Mux, Bitmovin). - Portfolio of similar live-streaming projects. ---### **Deliverables** 1. ùêàùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêØùê¢ùêûùê∞ ùêêùêÆùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß : ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ ùêéùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùê°ùêûùê•ùê© ùê¢ùêß ùêöùêØùê®ùê¢ùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêçùêÆùê•ùê•ùêèùê®ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêÑùê±ùêúùêûùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß? ‚úÖ Traditionally, if a method might return null, you'd have to manually check for null before accessing the value:String name = getUserName(); // might return nullif (name != null) { System.out.println(name.length());} else { // handle null}If you forget that null check and call name.length(), boom üí• ‚Äî NullPointerException.‚úÖ The Solution: OptionalInstead of returning null, return an Optional<T>:Optional<String> name = getUserName(); // returns Optional<String>name.ifPresent(n -> System.out.println(n.length()));Or with a default value:String result = name.orElse("Default Name");Or throwing an exception intentionally:String result = name.orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Name not found"));üì¶ How Optional HelpsForces explicit handling of absence of value.Avoids accidental null dereference.Cleaner, more readable code than nested null checks.üö® When it MattersFor performance-critical code (e.g., tight loops, mobile), Optional might have a micro-performance hit.For clean code, API design, and readability, Optional is a clear win.hashtag#interview hashtag#java

**Job Posting: Live CCTV Video Streaming Developer** **Position:** Freelance/Contract Developer (Remote) **Project Duration:** [3‚Äì6 months] **Budget:** ["Negotiable"] ---### **About the Project** We‚Äôre building a mobile/web app to display live video feeds from CCTV cameras (IP-based) in real time. The goal is to integrate secure, low-latency streaming from cameras using protocols like RTSP, HLS, or WebRTC. The app will serve both Android and iOS users, with potential web integration. ---### **Responsibilities** 1. Design and implement a live video streaming system for CCTV camera feeds. 2. Integrate camera streams (RTSP, ONVIF, or HTTP/MJPEG) into the app with playback functionality. 3. Optimize latency, quality, and bandwidth usage for real-time viewing. 4. Ensure secure access (token-based authentication, VPN, HTTPS). 5. Set up a backend proxy/transcoding server (e.g., NGINX, FFmpeg) if required. 6. Collaborate with our team to troubleshoot and test across devices/networks. 7. Document the architecture and workflows. ---### **Required Skills** - **Video Streaming Expertise**:  - Protocols: RTSP, HLS, WebRTC, RTMP.  - Tools: FFmpeg, GStreamer, ExoPlayer (Android), AVPlayer (iOS), or WebRTC libraries. - **Mobile/Web Development**:  - Android (Kotlin/Java) and/or iOS (Swift) for mobile apps.  - Web: JavaScript, HLS.js, video.js, or WebRTC (React/Node.js). - **Backend/Server Skills** (if needed):  - Setting up proxy servers (NGINX RTMP, Node.js).  - Cloud services (AWS IVS, GCP) for transcoding/CDN. - **Security**: HTTPS, DRM, token authentication, firewall rules. - **Testing**: Latency optimization, codec troubleshooting (H.264/H.265). ---### **Preferred Qualifications** - Experience with CCTV/IP camera systems (e.g., ONVIF, Dahua, Hikvision). - Knowledge of IoT frameworks (e.g., AWS IoT Core). - Familiarity with analytics tools (Mux, Bitmovin). - Portfolio of similar live-streaming projects. ---### **Deliverables** 1. A working app with live CCTV feed integration. 2. Documentation for setup, maintenance, and API usage. 3. Optimized streaming pipeline with <2s latency (if possible). ---### **How to Apply** Submit your proposal with: - A brief cover letter explaining your approach to live streaming. - Examples of past projects (GitHub, demos, or case studies). - Hourly rate or project-based quote. **Contact:** [muneebumughal@gmail.com] ---### **Why Work With Us?** - Opportunity to shape a scalable video surveillance solution. - Flexible remote work with a collaborative team.
